titleStmt.title: Catiche, Julia, Helen, and Joseph v. Walker, Chouteau, Pratte, and Amelin. Cover

bibl.title: State v. Walker, Chouteau, Pratte, Amelin. Cover
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p:
Alexis Amelin, to whom the writ of Habeas Corpus, hereto attached, was directed, commanding him to have the bodies of Catherine, Julia, Joseph and Helen, persons of colour, before this hon orable court, together with the cause of their caption and detainer , for return to said writ to the court here that the said Catherine Julia and Helen, were committed to the custody amd care of him the said Amelin, at Her culancum in the county of Jefferson, same time in the month of April - last by Alexander Scott Martin of the Steam boat General Brown as the agent of said Scott, for the purpose of bring ing the said Catherine Julia and Helen to S Louis and to make return of their bodies before the Honorable Robert Wash am of the Judges of the Supreme Court of the state of Missou ri in obedience to a writ of Habeas Cor pus, issued by said Judge directs to said Scott, that said Amelin brought the said Catherine Julia and Helen to S Louis as agent of said Scott, and on his return found that the said Judge had gone to Stleharly to att est a session of the Supreme Court; that said Amelin committed the said Catherine Julia & Helen to the custody of John K Walker Esqr Jailor of S Louis County for sage keeping, until the said Judge should re turn to his chambers, the said Catherine Julia & Helen were not taken out of the cusotdy of said Amelin, by order of said Judge, but were left with him as before the return by said Judge. That said
Catherine Julia and Helen are now in the actual custody of the said John K Walker and are detained by him at my until they shall be claimed and taken away from me by my principal or his authorities agent that I the said Amelin hold the said Julia Helen and Catherine in my custody in no other char unknown!then as the agent of said Scott & that they are not detained by me for any criminal or supposed criminal metter, & that they are now in the custody of said Walker, ready to be produced to this honorable Court by him on? said writ. And the said Ameline unknown! that Joseph, mentioned in said writ never was, nor is he now in my custody or constraint?, or detained by me in any manner whatsoeverm but is informed and believes that Pierre Chouteau Senior, who claims siad Josph as his slave, has sent him up the Missouri river. ----------------------------------
Sworn to in open Court A Amelin May 26th 1826 A Gamble Clerk
